top_categories.workout_context: 64ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Dirty Dino's Utah desert, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 55 miles.
At Dirty Dino, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Dirty Dino. Train it until it feels boring.
When someone attacks on Utah desert gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Dirty Dino's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
Varied gradients on Utah desert gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Dirty Dino, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
55 miles on Utah desert gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Base fitness for Dirty Dino. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Low-cadence force work for 3,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Dirty Dino’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Dirty Dino. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Dirty Dino requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on utah desert gravel to build confidence. Expect: utah desert, local event, mountain west gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 55 miles of utah desert gravel in Vernal, Utah.
